I don't like that last line of the mount cmd output: mount: warning: /etc/mtab is not writeable (e.g. read-only file-system)  That typically means your / filesystem had an error and the whole thing has gone read-only
I should add: it means "/" went that way, as /etc/ and /tmp are all on the / filesystem according to the mount output you shared
